text: of questions, be reserved until the time of trial.)
My name is Michael Manara.  I represent Mr. Kelly for an accident that occurred on April 3rd of 2017; does that sound about right?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: We are here today to take your deposition.
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: Have you ever been deposed before?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: Okay. So a couple ground rules kind of before we begin.  One, a deposition is simply a question and answer session.  It's not designed to trick or confuse you.  We're simply trying to find out what happened, okay?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: So a couple of ground rules for this deposition.  One, I need you to answer verbally because as you can see there's a court reporter here and she is typing down everything we say so she can't take down any hand gestures or head nods or anything like that; is that fair?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: All right. Second, uh-huh and uh-uh read the exact same way on the record.  So if we correct you and say is that a yes, is that a no, we're not doing it to be jerks, we're just trying to make sure the record is clear, all right?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: Third, simultaneous speaking while it's human nature you'll probably understand where I'm headed with my question, it's way too difficult for her to take down two people speaking at the same time.  So I ask that you allow me to finish my question before you answer.  I'll allow you to finish your answer before I ask my next question and we'll go back and forth in that cadence; is that fair?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: All right. Fourth, if at any time I'm speaking too fast or you do not understand the question, please let me know and I will be happy to rephrase.  Because if you answer my question I will assume two very important things, first, that you understood the question and second, that the answer is the truth; is that fair?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: Do you understand that the oath that you just took is the exact same oath you would take in a courtroom?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: All right. Did you understand the instructions that I have given?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: We are here today to discuss essentially three things.  One, the accident that occurred.  Two, the injuries you're claiming.  And three, any affects on your life.  Is there any reason you can't discuss those three things with me here today?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: All right. Are you understand the influence of any medications or substance that would prevent you from understanding my questions?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: Ever gone by any other names?
speaker: MR. MANARA

text: My maiden name, Connie Foulks, F-O-U-L-K-S.

text: The answers I gave to the --
